info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
Blackwater River near Dendron affecting Surry County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Blackwater River near Dendron.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 36.3 feet, Jones Town Drive and Walls Bridge Road begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 36.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM EDT Wednesday was 36.6 feet. - Forecast...The river level is expected to crest tonight, then slowly begin falling. - Flood stage is 36.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.4 feet on 01/21/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
